name: Introductory Physics I
description: This course covers the basic principles of classical mechanics, including kinematics, Newton's laws of motion, work and energy, rotational motion, linear momentum, and collisions.

name: Introductory Physics II
description: This course covers basic principles of electricity, magnetism, and optics. Topics include electrostatics, electric fields and potentials, DC and AC circuits, Maxwell’s equations, and geometric and wave optics.

name: Intermediate Physics I
description: This course covers topics in classical mechanics, including Lagrangian formalism, oscillatory motion, central force motion, and special relativity.

name: Intermediate Physics II
description: This course covers topics in electricity and magnetism, including electrostatics, Maxwell’s equations, electromagnetic waves, and applications of electric and magnetic fields.

name: Mathematical Physics I
description: This course covers basic mathematical techniques used in the study of physics, including vector calculus, ordinary and partial differential equations, and integral transforms.

name: Mathematical Physics II
description: This course covers advanced mathematical techniques used in the study of physics, including Fourier series, complex analysis, and special functions.
